body.directions: Listen to the audio, and then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.textVersion: Audio for 前边 qiánbiān (in front of)

body.quiz: Which of the following preposition words is the antonym of the word in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 后边 hòubiān (behind)
options: Audio for 上边 shàngbiān (on top)
Audio for 左边 zuǒbiān (left side)
Audio for 旁边 pángbiān (next to
body.correct: Outstanding work! 前边 qiánbiān means “in front of,” and its opposite is 后边 hòubiān (behind). Note that all these preposition words have the word 边 biān (side).
body.incorrect: Not quite. Listen again several times to identify which preposition word it is, and then consider what its opposite position is, and which preposition word in the choices describes it.

body.textVersion: Audio for 旁边 pángbiān (next to)

body.quiz: Which of the following objects’ relative locations cannot be accurately described by the word in the audio?
body.answer: Image of two stacked books©Shutterstock
options: Image of two chairs side by side©Shutterstock
Image of two laptops next to each other ©Shutterstock
Image of two cups of coffee next to each other©Shutterstock
body.correct: Totally fabulous! 旁边 pángbiān means “next to.” Of the images shown, each pair of the chairs, laptops, and cups of coffee are next to each other, while the books are stacked on top of each other.
body.incorrect: Oops. Listen to the audio several more times to identify what preposition word it is, and which position of the two objects in each of the images it cannot describe.

body.quiz: Which character in the word in the audio can be used by itself with the same meaning?
body.correct: Job wonderfully done! In the word 角落 jiǎoluò (corner), the first character, 角, can be used by itself with the same meaning: “corner.” You have selected the correct character out of the characters with similar shapes. Awesome!
body.incorrect: Oops. Listen to the audio several more times to identify the word and the characters it contains. Consider which character can be used by itself. Refer to the note under the vocabulary tiles for reference. Try not to be confused by the characters in the choices that have similar shapes.
